NadineScene2: ^Hello! How have you been? I have some good news for you.
Choice_findings: ^I investigated Kaylee’s office and found some weird things.
^There’s a note by Kaylee that potentially confirmed the rumors you told me at our first meeting.
^I also found a half-used medkit that could indicate violence.
^Do you think these two pieces of evidence are connected?
^Maybe someone found out about their secret, and Kaylee silenced them with force?
^This could be the case, but I’ve yet to figure out its connection to the death of Madeline.
Choice_olaf: ^I called Olaf and got a recorded alibi for you!
^We’ve also scheduled to meet in person to discuss the case further.
^This is the best news I’ve heard in so long! Thank you so much!
Choice_forensic: ^My good friend at the forensic department gave me some information about Madeline.
^According to the time of death and my speculation of the timeline, I think the killer was very close or even in the beauty room when you first found the body.
^Nadine’s face grows paler, and she lets out an audible gasp.
^Don’t let the fear linger; the killer didn’t do anything to you then, they surely wouldn’t do anything now.
^What’s more important for us now is the state of Madeline’s body.
^My friend said that Madeline’s knuckles are bruised with scratches. My thought is that she might have punched something right before her death.
^This reminds me of the glass-shattering sound you told me last time. Do you know what that could be?
^There isn’t a window in the beauty room, so it wouldn’t have been that.
^There are many mirrors in the beauty room, but I didn’t notice any of them being broken… Maybe because I was too shocked…
Choice_end: ^That’s most of what I have gathered so far. There are still some people left that I haven’t talked to yet. On that note, I’ve heard Madeline’s makeup artist being brought up on several occasions.
^Maybe she has some insight into the case.
^That’s okay. I’ll find a way to get the info. Wait for my good news!
^You are my only hope, Anna. See you later!
